result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan D Koehler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court
Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan D Koehler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
Recevied and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Ryan D Koehler in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant requests a revocation of the DPA agreement. Court granted defendant's request. The court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.

AS TO COUNT 1
Court ordered a Fine of $800.00 PLUS all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Court put defendant on payment plan of $100.00 per month beginning on 7/1/2015, and is to be paid on the 1st of the month, every month thereafter. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to tax intercept. 

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample and to pay the surcharge.
Per email from defense.  Case is adjourned from 9/8/2015 to 6/8/2015 at 10:00am. lms

Defendant Ryan D Koehler in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant has attended all but one contact.   Defendant will be beginning Thinking for a Change.  Defendant recently tested negative and will begin community service.  Review hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.
The Defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

Signed and filed, No Gun or Drug Order.  Defendant to not possess the following:
1)  any dangerous weapons, as defined by 939.22(10) Wis. Stats.
2)  or use any controlled substances unless valid prescription
3)  any drug paraphernalia, as defined by 961.571 Wis. Stats.
4)  make application for a concealed carry permit
and to following all other conditions of release stated in the order by the Court.  Order received, signed, and filed with the court.

Defendant Ryan D Koehler in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 6.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 3-2-2015 at 3:00pm
